I had no where else To place it. If you had only told me. Now, when I would touch you, I cannot sense your warmth. Is it the bandages That bind my wrists Or is it what they try to hide That keeps me from you? I would whisper words of love To free your soul of torment But for the threads That lace my thoughts Behind my teeth. My heart reaches out to you With its silent beat As you kneel at my side To give your grief To the empty shell That mirrors Who I once was. Your eyes look upon me Once more; Then twice For you have seen. The tears slide Effortlessly Down my pale cheek As the nerves Of the hand you held so near, So dear, Twitch one last time On my silken pillow. You never told me. The sins of the fathers, For three generations to follow. This is our debt? How we must pay? Our errors for our heirs? Enacted vicariously From this generation, To the next, And the next? I propose heresy. Genetic echoes Silenced. Karmic reverberations Dispensed. Do you see? I say no more. Stamped by their mistakes Just as surely As their better traits. Look you, Here, At this. JFK, Both senior and junior. Rugged good looks, Outdoor vigor, Wicked charm And nasty penchant For dying too soon. And, Here, Elvis. His little Lisa Marie. Songbird, Sexual sneer, Hip sway, All his way. Will it stop there? Or will she mimic His very end? And forever Be sighted At 7-11, Reduced to conspiracy theory And legend. To my own family, I turn. Grandfather, Molested my mother. Brother, Molested me, And, now, His step-daughter. Father, Accident-prone, Shy half his finger. My other brother, Accident-prone, too. Shy his life. And I, I am told, I Am the mirror image Of my paternal grandmother. She is etched In my features. Not five months ago I survived The same surgery That took her life. But no. By word of my father, It was a broken heart That stilled her breath. Grief in love Snuffing that spark. I say no. No. If I am to die, I die a heretic, Whole of heart, Old of age, Bearing my own sins Alone To my grave, Taking with me Her face, But no more than that. I entreat you, Let your sins Die with you. Leave our children as a legacy, Never again as penance.

How many hours did I spend Just watching you live? Caressing your silky skin, Placing the smallness of my hand Within that of your man-hand, Knowing all along that I did it To know you, to memorize every part of you…… In my own way I hoped my touch would enter your dreams Just as surely as you entered me that night. Your touch spoke for you, The timbre and tone of your caresses Every bit as deep as your voice, just as tantalizing. That night, as we held each other, You asked if I was in love with you. I told you I didn't know. But I do know. I love you as my friend, as my lover. If the two as one should mean that I love you, then there is no other answer, no other truth. I remember the feel of you, next to me in slumber, above and in me in love-making. Even now I can still smell you, the spicy, metallic tang of your body has been ingrained in my flesh. I can still taste you, feel your lips upon mine, your tongue a messenger of passion. Know that I am happy, that our friendship, our love-making, is all I need of you, all I will ask of you, until the time should come that you desire more of me. Know that what you have given me, being the first to be my lover, has placed you as special in my heart, in my memories. I'll not forget you, my love, nor our passionate friendship. Romance is not ours, for romance is for books, for fantasy. You, dearheart, are quite real.

Silence is never so loud as when it is shared. Lying.. if they're strangers, they shouldn't matter enough to you to lie to them. Little white lies to save their feelings, perhaps.. (No, Louie, you DON'T look like a serial killer), but not about life in general or in specific. No point in it. And if you know them, then they should matter enough NOT to lie to them. Neh? Games and manipulation.. much like the issue of lying. Except I don't see any exception to this. Be direct. You only honor yourself, and whomever you speak with, if you are forthright and direct. If something goes awry in communication, try try again. But know that you aren't murking the waters with deception. You waste your life, and time, much less theirs, in bothering with that. Love. I say this having been through more pain than I wish to discuss.. pain I don't wish to repeat. Even knowing and feeling this.. I say to you, no love given or shown is wasted. Even should the recipient act in opposition to my above thoughts. Even should they hurt, neglect, or revile you, take advantage of you, abuse or dismiss you. Love, when given or shown in truth, has not been wasted, because it is the beauty in you shining out. Pity those that mistreat such gestures. And love on. Friends. I cannot say this enough, and try on a daily basis to improve upon my own actions, having few I deem as close. Know them for the treasures they are, and remind them that they are treasured. We're all in the process of trying to be and do better things. Not a one of us would succeed and persevere if it weren't for those that love us and support our efforts by presence alone. Family. They're yours, whether you want them or not. Apply the above semantics, laugh a lot, and pray a lot, to whomever you pray. I know some families are not blessings.. are, sometimes, even, a curse in too many sad instances. So if nothing else, pray to survive them. As mine prays to survive me, neh?

So. I was still awake at 2 this morning, lying in bed, thinking about Otis Redding. Or his songs, at least. What? Doesn't EVERYBODY find themselves awake in the wee hours with Otis Redding songs in their head? Try A Little Tenderness was ringing in mine. "Young girls do get weary, wearing that same old shaggy dress, yes.." I'm about a month away from seeing about getting a reliable car. And the behemoth I'm driving decides it's going to try and kill me before I can dispense with it. Somebody said once that I should name it Morgan, a play on morgue, for a hearse or the kind of car mob hit men might drive. I don't know that I perceive a Chrysler Fifth Avenue as mafia material, but I'd agree with the whole grim reaper aspect to the sucker. The brakes went out. Again. After replacing the master cylinder. (don't ask me, I barely get what that is, myself) So she's trying to kill me, this metal monster. I think I simply don't get along with machinery. She resents that I'm replacing her. And now my computer is trying to commit suicide. It seems to be eating itself, insofar as memory space on the main hard drive goes. I think, overall, it means I need to spend less time with the two of them. Shed my shaggy metal dress, not let these malfunctions drag me down. It's starting to be spring and summer out there. Thinking about trying a little tenderness on myself, and seeing what goes on outside of the midnight hour. I'll be going to the Shakespeare Festival in July, and will be taking my birthday off for the first time in years. I'm taking a couple friends to see Spiderman 2 that day. And then doing whatever else comes into my head to do. Odd concept, that. Doing whatever I want. *sighs* I do know that once my adversary is functional enough to actually STOP when I step on the brakes, I’m going to start taking drives out to the lake and other outlying areas and just go for walks. Start breathing. (I, btw, hated Waiting To Exhale. A little overdone, for my tastes. So I’m NOT waiting to exhale, folks. This is more of an oxygenating, take it in deal) And see what Otis has to say to me, then.

Okay, keep in mind I'm a Cancer, for whatever that means in the scheme of things. So that title has more to do with that than my temper. It seems I’ve become somewhat of an oracle or an advice columnist to friends and strangers alike. I’ve got one stranger stalking me (yes, I’ve developed another stalker… it’s like a rash that keeps coming back, but itches in different spots) with the obsessed belief that I can answer for the world, much less whatever troubles are in his life. This guy doesn’t even know what he’s dealing with. I weathered Danny. This guy is small fries, comparatively speaking. I just don’t get how I’ve somehow become stalker bait, much less how people think I can give them direction in their lives when I can’t put direction in my own. Perhaps because it’s easier for me to give advice with clear eyes for others than it is to follow my own advice. So, between my own advice doing me no good, and my writing skills serving no purpose, I’m thinking I either need to start up working as exactly that.. an advice columnist.. or contact Hallmark and start creating greeting cards. Make these useless skills (insofar as them serving any purpose for me) do something to benefit me. Every once in a while I have a man ask me why I’m not already taken by somebody. It seems to me the same could be asked of those that pose that question, but regardless, they seem to figure it out in the long run. I’ve given up on seeing through the eyes of others, when it comes to what they see when looking at me. Just helped one friend figure out he was being an idiot about a woman in his life.. ie, don’t look a gift horse in the mouth, just saddle it and go. Why people struggle against the chance for happiness when it comes their way, I don’t think I’ll ever understand. But it’s such a tricky thing.. finding what that happiness is. Always one person or the other.. never both.. seeming to look at one another and thinking.. yes. This would be happiness. But only one of the two. That’s always the problem. So here my friend is, looking at her, and she’s looking at him.. and both thinking, yes. Yet he struggled against it. *sighs* I know. It’s always easier looking in from the outside on these situations. I’m just still adjusting to being on the outside in all things. On that lovely, cheerful, exhausted note (insomnia.. you hag, you), yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus. Or something to that effect, dear readers.

So it's just after 3 Sunday morning, and I'm still coming down off of my Oregon Shakespeare Festival high. My friend, Tiffany, and I were doing a caffeine pill, sugar cookie, loud music buzz to drive for three and a half hours (okay, three, with how Tiff drives) to get back to town. It was my first time to the festival, and I'm too jazzed for words, being the Shakespeare freak I am. She and I have made a pact to go back every year together, maybe trading off each year from comedy to drama to tragedy, etc. Switch it up a bit. Spent way more than I should have, but I'm beyond caring. Haven't vacationed in about three years, and never let myself just be... so it has been a long time coming. I won't say there weren't sad moments for me. Still not past my feelings for a certain party, regardless of his lack of feelings for me, this whole time, it seems. Saw a Bob Marley shirt, thought of him. Saw a peacock feather, thought of him and his cat. He'd agreed to go with us to the festival, back a year ago, when she and I had first discussed it. But life changes, as do people, and I really don't know if that was just one more thing he said to me without ever meaning it. Irony of it is, today, Sunday, is his birthday. His mom died a year ago last Thursday. His ninth wedding anniversary with his beloved/hated wife was on my birthday. Doesn't matter that I never mattered to him. I loved him, and part of me still does. Echoes of those feelings still resounding off my heart at times, but this, too, shall pass, as do all things. So, to the better subject of the festival. Can't begin to describe to you the many treasures I brought back with me, but suffice it to say, I've started replacing the rings I lost (after they slipped off my fingers unnoticed after losing the 110 lbs), and have added a lovely windchime to those I already have, which my ex-husband hated hearing. Tiff and I wandered all over hell and back in that town and STILL didn't cover it all, but capped the day off with a lovely dinner (shrimp pasta for her, lemon snapper for me), after which we ran like mad women to the play in a beautiful Elizabethan theatre (also named that), with an open air stage. Reminds me somewhat of the one in Shakespeare in Love, a movie I oft grumble about. We've had our tickets for Much Ado About Nothing since February. But something that was, somehow, the best part of the evening for me... I'm always saying everybody's self perception is screwed, comparatively speaking, versus what anybody else perceives of them. My self esteem has straightened out pretty well from having been too heavy for too long, and I've quit seeing the stares of strangers as repulsion, and figured out what the men are thinking... but wow. Get this. In the scene wherein Benedict is speaking of what aspects he would find pleasing, and acceptable, in a wife, he first names three aspects, being a lady fair in feature, one who is wise, and one who is virtuous, pointing out three women in particular in the audience for these aspects, one to stage left, one to center stage, and one to stage right. Starting with lady fair, he pointed to, and looked directly at, me three rows back. I know he had to have picked us out ahead of time, because it wasn't a thing of searching faces and settling. Quite direct about looking at we three in turn. Tho' I'd note it that he made a joke of hesitating about the third lady, as if realizing she wasn't so virtuous, and switching back to the wise lady to also label her as virtuous, to which the audience took great delight. Great day, great night, am DEFINITELY going to repeat it.

'Cause this young girl is all fed up with feeling this weary. I have to wonder why I'm paying a therapist, when it seems like going back to sleeping with a stuffed animal (yes, I know.. regression) seems to be giving me the best sleep I've had in some time. My friend, Reed, and I went and saw Shrek 2 together. He later won a stuffed Shrek 2 Shrek doll from one of those crane games, gave it to me. I got home from housesitting this last Sunday, went to climb into bed that night, and the Shrek doll was laying on my bed. So I thought.. what the hell. Wrapped my arm around it, curled up, fell to sleep. My friend Tiffany posited the notion that it's because I want to curl up with somebody.. have that closeness and affection. Perhaps a stuffed animal, having no issues of its own, no needs.. nothing.. no strings attached, as it were.. gives me the unconditional cuddle I've needed. It doesn't dawn on me real often how much I miss Garfield, because I know he's better off.. but moments like that.. yeah. So. Also having figured out how abysmally horrible I seem to be at the "contact with other humans" game, I decided to quit caring. Hasn't seemed to do me any good in the last two years or so. Experienced a lot of pain, wrote a lot of poetry.. and that's about it. I figured out I don't want to be alone. I figured out I have no control over that, and the likelihood of meeting somebody compatible, much less somebody who would be passionate about me as I would be passionate about them? Well. I'm 33. Hasn't happened yet. Not mutually speaking, at least. So up goes the white flag. I expect I'll be doing some camping by myself. Lot of other things by myself. But I think I'm also finding peace in that, finally. Don't know if the difference is a Shrek doll, or simply no longer aching for what I can't have. Who knows? I still say shut up, Otis.
